snippet.textDisplay: i strongly disagree with people who think this demeaned Tagore. some even tried to make the point that this poem should not have been used in this experiment. stop being hypocrites. to most bengalis Tagore is now just an ornament to show off. we perform his songs, talk about him so mcuh but little do we realize his depth of thinking, work. so it's better to experiment with his work than keep them stagnant.
snippet.textOriginal: i strongly disagree with people who think this demeaned Tagore. some even tried to make the point that this poem should not have been used in this experiment. stop being hypocrites. to most bengalis Tagore is now just an ornament to show off. we perform his songs, talk about him so mcuh but little do we realize his depth of thinking, work. so it's better to experiment with his work than keep them stagnant.

snippet.textDisplay: Absolutely. If it is such a big issue, then people should have by now killed Ravi Shastri for pronouncing Kolkata consistently as "Kolkota"... Rehman's Hindi diction is not great as well, but no one's complaining. Bengalis used to be fussy abt these small things for ages and thankfully the recent generations hv moved out of these for good, few exceptions remain. I am a trained in Rabindra Sangeet myself and I know how most Rabindra Sangeet singers sing in their own twisted diction.
snippet.textOriginal: Absolutely. If it is such a big issue, then people should have by now killed Ravi Shastri for pronouncing Kolkata consistently as "Kolkota"... Rehman's Hindi diction is not great as well, but no one's complaining. snippet.textDisplay:
dude, get out of the preaching mode as who should do what. You do what is best for you, end of story. Keep that to yourself. If you think that AR is above all criticism then, its just being a fan-boy which I refuse to be. 

You are being emotional on the eve of Independence day. Thats okay. but here, we are talking about correctness of a diction of a very popular language. Hiring a singer who can sing a bengali song with correct diction is not much.
snippet.textOriginal:
dude, get out of the preaching mode as who should do what. You do what is best for you, end of story. Keep that to yourself. If you think that AR is above all criticism then, its just being a fan-boy which I refuse to be. 

You are being emotional on the eve of Independence day. Thats okay. but here, we are talking about correctness of a diction of a very popular language. Hiring a singer who can sing a bengali song with correct diction is not much.

snippet.textDisplay: Now u're making sense. But Tagore is "everyone's property" not "nobody's". Every field of human knowledge be it Science, Maths, Music, Painting, Literature, Architecture is a continuous process of development, get this straight absolutely no creation is ORIGINAL, every single one is influenced by the ones before. Now who covers the earlier tracks better is a question of real mastery & not everyone is equally successful. Einstein said “Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources”. Cheers
snippet.textOriginal: Now u're making sense. But Tagore is "everyone's property" not "nobody's". snippet.textDisplay:
Dont know how many people realise - this is Rabindranath Tagore's "Where the mind is without fear"

Listen to it from 2:40

"Mann mein bhay ki boond bhi na ho" (Where the mind is without fear)
"Matha ooncha lehraaye" (And the head is held high)
"Gyan, mukt, azaad....."(where knowledge is free)
"Dharti bat na paaye..."(Where the world has not broken in up into fragments..)
and so on...
snippet.textOriginal:

"Matha ooncha lehraaye" (And the head is held high)
"Gyan, mukt, azaad....."(where knowledge is free)
"Dharti bat na paaye..."(Where the world has not broken in up into fragments..)
and so on...

snippet.textDisplay:
Yes, I apologize, may b I was rude. Bt, as only y hv said, Tagore is nt any Bengali's property, Tagore is nobody's property. All u hv said is right, but can u tell me why v can't be original? Tagore hd used tunes frm many genres across d world bt u won't b able to recognize them on d 1st go, the blend is so subtle. Bt now v directly use them, copy them. V do it for every piece of music which bcmes famous.
I'm a die hard fan of Rahman since I was child. Music is sweetest when its original.
snippet.textOriginal:
Yes, I apologize, may b I was rude. Bt, as only y hv said, Tagore is nt any Bengali's property, Tagore is nobody's property. All u hv said is right, but can u tell me why v can't be original? Tagore hd used tunes frm many genres across d world bt u won't b able to recognize them on d 1st go, the blend is so subtle. Bt now v directly use them, copy them. V do it for every piece of music which bcmes famous.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree the diction could have been better but there are just so many things in this world which could have been better, nothing is prefect. It is a matter of how you look at things. On the eve of Independence Day, such an emotional and patriotic creation, uniting one of lndia's best visionaries and one of India's best musicians is just the best thing possible. I dont stay in the country and was immensely moved by this. Focus on the positives of things & the world would look better to you.

snippet.textDisplay: Who are you to judge what's right and what's wrong??? I am a Bengali too and simply floored by this creation. Tagore would have felt proud too coz he was very open-minded and had himself been influenced by the English Classical music, Carnatic music and used the tunes in many of his songs... go, read up, research and then comment. And Tagore doesnt become a personal property of Bengalis simply coz he was born in Bengal. So dont shame Bengalis any more with your narrow-mindedness and get a life.
snippet.textOriginal: Who are you to judge what's right and what's wrong??? I am a Bengali too and simply floored by this creation. Tagore would have felt proud too coz he was very open-minded and had himself been influenced by the English Classical music, Carnatic music and used the tunes in many of his songs... go, read up, research and then comment. And Tagore doesnt become a personal property of Bengalis simply coz he was born in Bengal. So dont shame Bengalis any more with your narrow-mindedness and get a life.

snippet.textDisplay: Who cares, rudresh... I am a Bengali too and a trained Rabindra-Sangeet singer and don't mind non-Bengalis trying to sing a Bengali song.Get out of these narrow-mindedness. And I know how most of our so-called Rabindra-Sangeet singers sing Tagore songs with their own twisted diction. Suchi is a Bengali and sang the more difficult lines. Try to understand the feelings of a composer who felt compelled to show his respect to the master poet. I bet Tagore would've felt proud! Music is universal..
snippet.textOriginal: Who cares, rudresh... I am a Bengali too and a trained Rabindra-Sangeet singer and don't mind non-Bengalis trying to sing a Bengali song.Get out of these narrow-mindedness. And I know how most of our so-called Rabindra-Sangeet singers sing Tagore songs with their own twisted diction. Suchi is a Bengali and sang the more difficult lines. Try to understand the feelings of a composer who felt compelled to show his respect to the master poet. I bet Tagore would've felt proud! Music is universal..

snippet.textDisplay:
Jana Gana Mana has highly  Sanskritised bengali wordings, one of the reason that a Non-bengali can easily pronounce and understand it. Where is this lyrics are very much bengali. Can't be compared on same line. 

The point here is a Bengali singer would have done better job of this song than AR singing himself. The spirit would have been same if not better.
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay: Wow... Rehman, no words for such excellence... You made Tagore proud! Indeed such vision a 100 years back when Tagore wrote this is mind-blowing! If Tagore was alive, he would have blessed you! Please continue the good work...this is even better than Zarya...
snippet.textOriginal: Wow... Rehman, no words for such excellence... You made Tagore proud! Indeed such vision a 100 years back when Tagore wrote this is mind-blowing! If Tagore was alive, he would have blessed you! Please continue the good work...this is even better than Zarya...

snippet.textDisplay: This is an excellent fusion by Rehman. And he has shown great honor & respect by singing the original in Bengali. He could have just sang the Hindi version but he didn't and I salute him for that. The Bengali portion has added an extra dimension to the rendition. And he has used Suchi in the more difficult lines. Man, anyone can sing a Tagore song or any song in any language and a Tagore song is not the sole property of Bengalis. Its time we become INDIANS in the truest sense!
snippet.textOriginal: This is an excellent fusion by Rehman. And he has shown great honor & respect by singing the original in Bengali. He could have just sang the Hindi version but he didn't and I salute him for that. The Bengali portion has added an extra dimension to the rendition. And he has used Suchi in the more difficult lines. Man, anyone can sing a Tagore song or any song in any language and a Tagore song is not the sole property of Bengalis. Its time we become INDIANS in the truest sense!

snippet.textDisplay: I do not understand Bengali still I sing Jana Gana Mana - the ultimate spirit its my Nation's Anthem, I do not question diction or how I pronounce it - at the same time each language has to be respected here - with AR Rahman I see it as my National spirit more than the language diction.
snippet.textOriginal: I do not understand Bengali still I sing Jana Gana Mana - the ultimate spirit its my Nation's Anthem, I do not question diction or how I pronounce it - at the same time each language has to be respected here - with AR Rahman I see it as my National spirit more than the language diction.

snippet.textDisplay:
Great arrangements, but I would have seriously appreciated if AR Rehman didn't try to sing Tagore's song in Bengali, Diction just hurts ears. 

There are many bengali contemporary Rabindra Sangeet singers who would have been easily used in this song.
snippet.textOriginal:
Great arrangements, but I would have seriously appreciated if AR Rehman didn't try to sing Tagore's song in Bengali, Diction just hurts ears.

snippet.textDisplay: AR Rahman is my GOD! Musical GOD!! Allah Rakha!
snippet.textOriginal: AR Rahman is my GOD! Musical GOD!! Allah Rakha!

snippet.textDisplay: I would pay anything to just sit in that room!!! Awesome composing. Only can be done by GURU Rahman.
snippet.textOriginal: I would pay anything to just sit in that room!!! Awesome composing. Only can be done by GURU Rahman.

snippet.textDisplay:
The ending of this song just BLEW THE ROOFFFFFF!!!!! Wow.... Sivamani was just O.U.T.S.T.A.N.D.I.N.G! Amazing Kunnakol by Siva.... Rahman sings the song with almost no traces of facial effort, but his voice is portraying a very high effort. Is he always like this, or is this video recorded at a diff time from the recording of the song?

Blaaze's rap was awesome too! After a long time, Blaaze is in elements in a Rahman song... Totally seductive song this! Brilliant work! ARR the Boss!
snippet.textOriginal:
